I now have a hefty queen battery and Black’s king is exposed on f7 with queenside pieces undeveloped.

Checks and threats that jump out:

- Qh7+ still unreachable.  
- Qg6+ removes the queen pair but is continuation neutral.  
- Qh6+ forces the king either to f6 (after …Kf6 the inter-mezzo Bc4+, Ne7, or g4+ are gross) or to e7 where h2-h4–h5 strengthen the bind.

Top priority is therefore fire the first check with tempo to bring more men into the assault.

Bring the last piece into the attack by developing the knight to c3, threatening to fork his loose rook, bishop and king with Nc3–b5+ or Nc3–e4+ while also preparing Rf6+.
